results.title: The Battle of Midway
results.creator_credit: John Ford and United States. Dept. of the Navy
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Why we fight”.
John Ford’s Academy Award winning documentary filmed during the Battle of Midway. Narration combines with visuals of the naval air battle, hospitalization of the injured and burial services in a patriotic tribute to the people from the United States battling the Japanese. Suitable for Tertiary level students.

results.title: Pool sharks
results.creator_credit: Edwin Middleton, Essex Films and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: W.C. Fields’ first film displaying his prowess at the pool table; rivals for the same girl find that a “friendly” game does not help to settle the matter. A useful comparison with later films in terms of the development of character, history of comedy and the role of women. Written by W.C. Fields and musical score by Stuart Oderman.

results.title: The Care we take
results.creator_credit: Tim Sullivan, Bruce Moir, Film House Company and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Provides a comprehensive look at the Australian barley industry in South Australia and Victoria as controlled by the Australian Barley Board. Deals with all aspects from research and growing to marketing and final uses of barley. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tim Sullivan, Bruce Moir, Film House Company and South Australian Film Corporation

results.title: Interviews with My Lai veterans
results.creator_credit: Joseph Strick and Laser Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Five American soldiers present their recollections of the events at My Lai, Vietnam on 16th March 1968. During their interviews such matters as the training of soldiers, the strategy of My Lai and the details of the massacre are discussed. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
results.description: Five American soldiers present their recollections of the events at My Lai, Vietnam on 16th March 1968. results.title: Canker at the core
results.creator_credit: Scott Hicks, Terry Jennings and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Part 2 of a series on Australian women artists, examining some of their thoughts, struggles, aspirations, influences and disappointments, and the effect of sexual discrimination and stereotyping. Features the following artists: Barbara Hanrahan, Anne Graham, Jacqueline Hick, Elizabeth Durack, Marian Hardman, Elise Bluman, Joan Brassil, Dora Chapman, Sybil Craig, Grace Cossington-Smith. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels and tertiary level.

results.title: Women artists of Australia. Part 1. Sense and sensibility
results.creator_credit: Scott Hicks, Terry Jennings, Art Gallery of South Australia, Chrysalis Films and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: An analysis of Australian women artists, presenting some of their thoughts, struggles, aspirations, influences and disappointments. Examines the effect of sexual discrimination and stereotyping. Includes interviews with the following artists: Elise Bluman, Vicki Varvaressos, Julie Millowick, Inge King, Lesley Dumbrell, Penny Smith, Kate Briscoe, Sandra leveson, Leah MacKinnon, Jacqueline Hick, Margaret Dodd, Rinske Car, Micky Allan, Nora Heysen, Barbara Hanrahan and Anne Newmarch.

results.title: Jacob: 'Everybody's allowed to cry'
results.creator_credit: Lyn Bugden, Australian Film Commission and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A moving documentation of the life of a small boy about to face his sixth major operation in six years. Raises questions of care for the hospitalised, the rights of the patient and family, and the emotional requirements of people reliant on technology for life support. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Ashes and diamonds
results.brief_description: The third part of a massive trilogy dedicated to the youth of Poland in the Second World War. In this extract the action takes place in the late afternoon preceeding the Communist liberation. The hero, Maciek, leads the resistance group, which owes allegiance to the Polish National Government exiled in London. His orders are to assassinate the new Communist District Secretary, Szczuka. Based on the book “Ashes and diamonds” by Jerzy Andrzejewski.

results.title: As we talk we learn (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Brian Bergin, Malcolm Smith and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Language, specifically talking, is a valuable, perhaps essential element in processes of learning. This film looks at communication between teacher and pupil is necessary in order to maximize the learning process. Various kinds of classroom talking are illustrated in order to determine which is the most effective technique for learning.
